allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___facility.description: Facility where the services were provided.

___status.description: The status of the resource instance.

___type.description: The category of claim, eg, oral, pharmacy, vision, insitutional, professional.

___employmentImpacted.description: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was precluded from working due to the treatable condition(s).

___accident.description: An accident which resulted in the need for healthcare services.

___created.description: The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

___billablePeriod.description: The billable period for which charges are being submitted.

___hospitalization.description: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was confined to a treatment center.

___prescription.description: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

___total.description: The total value of the claim.

___provider.description: The provider which is responsible for the bill, claim pre-determination, pre-authorization.

___careTeam.description: The members of the team who provided the overall service as well as their role and whether responsible and qualifications.

___identifier.description: The business identifier for the instance: claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

___insurance.description: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

___payee.description: The party to be reimbursed for the services.

___originalPrescription.description: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

___item.description: First tier of goods and services.

___organization.description: The organization which is responsible for the bill, claim pre-determination, pre-authorization.

___subType.description: A finer grained suite of claim subtype codes which may convey Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service. In the US the BillType.

___referral.description: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

___procedure.description: Ordered list of patient procedures performed to support the adjudication.

___enterer.description: Person who created the invoice/claim/pre-determination or pre-authorization.

___diagnosis.description: List of patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

___fundsReserve.description: In the case of a Pre-Determination/Pre-Authorization the provider may request that funds in the amount of the expected Benefit be reserved ('Patient' or 'Provider') to pay for the Benefits determined on the subsequent claim(s). 'None' explicitly indicates no funds reserving is requested.

___related.description: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

___information.description: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues. Often there are mutiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

___insurer.description: The Insurer who is target of the request.

description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: A resource that includes narrative, extensions, and contained resources.

___text.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

___contained.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

___extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___facility.description: Facility where the services were provided.

___status.description: The status of the resource instance.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___type.description: The category of claim, eg, oral, pharmacy, vision, insitutional, professional.

allOf.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

___start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

___end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

___employmentImpacted.description: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was precluded from working due to the treatable condition(s).

___provider.description: The provider which is responsible for the bill, claim pre-determination, pre-authorization.

___careTeam.description: The members of the team who provided the overall service as well as their role and whether responsible and qualifications.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___sequence.description: Sequence of the careTeam which serves to order and provide a link.

___provider.description: Member of the team who provided the overall service.

___role.description: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisiplinary team.

___qualification.description: The qualification which is applicable for this service.

___responsible.description: The party who is billing and responsible for the claimed good or service rendered to the patient.

___identifier.description: The business identifier for the instance: claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

allOf.description: A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.

___type.description: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

___period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

___value.description: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

___system.description: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

___insurance.description: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___sequence.description: Sequence of coverage which serves to provide a link and convey coordination of benefit order.

___businessArrangement.description: The contract number of a business agreement which describes the terms and conditions.

___focal.description: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is the focus for adjudication. The Coverage against which the claim is to be adjudicated.

___coverage.description: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

___preAuthRef.description: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___party.description: Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

___type.description: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

___payee.description: The party to be reimbursed for the services.

allOf.description: A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___originalPrescription.description: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

___item.description: First tier of goods and services.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___procedureLinkId.description: Procedures applicable for this service or product line.

___modifier.description: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

___bodySite.description: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc).

___diagnosisLinkId.description: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product line.

___unitPrice.description: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

___careTeamLinkId.description: CareTeam applicable for this service or product line.

___servicedDate.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

___subSite.description: A region or surface of the site, eg. limb region or tooth surface(s).

___detail.description: Second tier of goods and services.

___udi.description: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

___quantity.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

___service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,RXNorm,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

___encounter.description: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

___informationLinkId.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information pplicable for this service or product line.

___factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

___revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

___category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

___servicedPeriod.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

___net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

___programCode.description: For programs which require reason codes for the inclusion or covering of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

___timingPeriod.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

___code.description: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought which may influence the adjudication.

For referring to data content defined in other formats.

___language.description: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

___title.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

___contentType.description: Identifies the type of the data in the attachment and allows a method to be chosen to interpret or render the data. Includes mime type parameters such as charset where appropriate.

___url.description: An alternative location where the data can be accessed.

___hash.description: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.

___creation.description: The date that the attachment was first created.

___size.description: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).

___data.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes. In XML, represented using base64.

___valueAttachment.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

allOf.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

___start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

___end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

___timingPeriod.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

allOf.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

___comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

___code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

___value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

___unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

___system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

___valueQuantity.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

___timingDate.description: The date when or period to which this information refers.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___reason.description: For example, provides the reason for: the additional stay, or missing tooth or any other situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

___valueString.description: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

allOf.description: A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___sequence.description: Sequence of the information element which serves to provide a link.

___code.description: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought which may influence the adjudication.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

An address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats).  This data type may be used to convey addresses for use in delivering mail as well as for visiting locations which might not be valid for mail delivery.  There are a variety of postal address formats defined around the world.

___type.description: Distinguishes between physical addresses (those you can visit) and mailing addresses (e.g. PO Boxes and care-of addresses). Most addresses are both.

___period.description: Time period when address was/is in use.

___line.description: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction,  P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.

___district.description: The name of the administrative area (county).

___text.description: A full text representation of the address.

___state.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes).

___country.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

___postalCode.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

___city.description: The name of the city, town, village or other community or delivery center.

___date.description: Date of an accident which these services are addressing.

___version.description: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

___display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

___service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

___factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

___subDetail.description: Third tier of goods and services.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

___unitPrice.description: The fee for an addittional service or product or charge.

___revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

___category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

___net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

___state.description: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes).

___country.description: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.

___postalCode.description: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.

___city.description: The name of the city, town, village or other community or delivery center.

allOf.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

___comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

___code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

___value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

___unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

___system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

___quantity.description: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___service.description: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,RXNorm,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

___encounter.description: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

allOf.description: A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___informationLinkId.description: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information pplicable for this service or product line.

___factor.description: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___revenue.description: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___category.description: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

allOf.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

___start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

___end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

___servicedPeriod.description: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

allOf.description: An amount of economic utility in some recognized currency.

___net.description: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

___programCode.description: For programs which require reason codes for the inclusion or covering of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

allOf.description: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

allOf.description: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

___date.description: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed .
